definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
fragrant/sweet smelling/aromatic/savory or appetizing/(to eat) with relish/(of sleep) sound/perfume or spice/joss or incense stick/CL:根[gen1]

sentences.english: Delusions, whether about tulips or Internet stocks, produce bubbles.
sentences.chinese: 无论是对郁金香还是网络股票的错觉都产生了泡沫。

sentences.english: Fine Lanling wine expires tulip's fragrance.
You know, I remember I doubted that tulips could possibly be worth so much.
sentences.chinese: 你知道，我记得我怀疑郁金香可能是值得这么多。

sentences.english: Her tiny, round lips were full like a tulip bulb.
sentences.chinese: 两片小而圆润的嘴唇好似郁金香的球茎般丰满。

sentences.english: My parents love to go to Holland to see all of the different types growing there.
sentences.chinese: 我父母喜欢去荷兰欣赏那里种植的所有种类的郁金香。

sentences.english: the value of one tulip bulb would sometimes be that of an entire house.
sentences.chinese: 一个郁金香球茎的价值，有时是因为一个完整的房子。

sentences.english: Tulip changing our lives, led by the Department of Shanyou our great love.
sentences.chinese: 郁金香改变着我们的生活，牵系着我们的汕大情。

sentences.english: Black tulips, right here in China, not anywhere else, right at the Shanghai Flower Port.
sentences.chinese: 黑郁金香，不在别处，就在中国，在上海鲜花港。

sentences.english: At last she believed that the tulip bed was under the protection of the fairies.
sentences.chinese: 她终于相信，郁金香花圃是受了仙女的保护。

sentences.english: The rose, the pink, the tulip gay.
sentences.chinese: 玫瑰呀，石竹呀，还有郁金香。

sentences.english: The red and white tulip is very beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 这朵红白色的郁金香很美。

sentences.english: She went to the tulips and began cutting them off, one after another.
sentences.chinese: 她走向郁金香并开始剪下一朵又一朵。

sentences.english: Like the boundless prairie in a tulip, elegant but overwhelmingly fragrance.
sentences.chinese: 犹如茫茫草原中的一朵郁金香，冷艳却又无比芳香。

sentences.english: I would fly to Holland to see the windmills and the tulips.
sentences.chinese: 我要飞到荷兰去看风车和郁金香。

sentences.english: Will you stand close to the tulip flowers?
sentences.chinese: 你站在紧靠郁金香花的场地，好吗？

sentences.english: She waters the tulips every morning.
sentences.chinese: 她每天早晨都给郁金香浇水。

pinyin: Ku4 ken3 huo4 fu1 Gong1 yuan2

definition: oriental cherry (Prunus serrulata or Prunus yedoensis), prized for its blossom/also known as sakura (Japanese) or Yoshino cherry
